Comments_List: I learned how to use statistical programming language including SAS, R, SPSS to conduct multivariable statistical analysis.
Developed theoretical basis on Multivariate statistics
A lot
Several multivariate methods.
Several useful data analysis
I developed a deeper understanding of SEM and factor analysis

New statistical methods
learnt R language
Learnt how to use SPSS
Strengthened my knowledge of SAS
Big ideas of multivariate data analysis

ZERO.

Just kidding. I became much more proficient with SAS, and now I have many more tools to help me navigate R, SPSS, and Minitab! Working with large datasets to explore how variables are related is going to be much more fun, now that I have these statistical methods to tease out the more nuanced relationships.
I learned R.

Strength: A practical course which taught us how to use four statistical programming language to conduct multivariate statistical analysis. An advanced course for data analysis. It has video recording, which helped us to go through the course materials. Homework assigned with detailed illustration also make it easy to understand and use the knowledge.
Can strengthen theoretical basis on Multivariate statistics
Very interesting course and great teaching style.

Recording the videos and putting them online has many obvious advantages...but I think overall it's not really worth the lower levels of engagement it tends to encourage. I'd be surprised if even half the class ended up watching the SEM videos.

Hope lecture notes could contain more interpretation of the examples. Sometimes I cannot catch up with the instructor's thoughts. I hope I could learn more from the lecture notes, especially about the interpretation, but not just from the lectures.
I really appreciated that JDRS allowed students to watch lectures online. He is THAT good!

Strengths: Video recording
Weakness: Video recording (seems like a detached way of learning) class to far from my primary location
Homework assignment deadlines kept changing, and it really threw me off. Things worked out, but it was a tad disorienting.
I think the best thing about this course is it is very well structured and organized. Also, class materials are extremely helpful, even after the completion of the course.

I strongly recommend this class to other students no matter which specific subject you are major in. Since data based analysis is fundamental for each area today. What's more, the content and methods taught by this class are practical, i.e. ,you can directly use the method on your data analysis.
Yes
Yes
I would recommend it if the methods that the class covers is likely relevant to the person, especially if they're a student in the forestry/environmental studies department.
Absolutely!
Yes, definitely recommended to everyone with or without statistical background. Learned a lot!

Yes! JDRS was a great lecturer (even if you just read the lecture notes, you wouldn't fully understand the material until he walked you through it in lecture). And because I had a scheduling conflict, the fact that it was live-streamed CHANGED MY MIND. If they do that again next year, I would recommend all students who want to learn more advanced statistical methods to take this class.
